content.description:
Sweaty Purge climbs an undercut bulge via compression movement. Big arms spans will make this go much easier.

Sit start with hands spread far apart on opposing sidepull edges and a right foot edge. From there, stick a left hand jug sidepull, bump the right hand up to a sidepull, bump the left hand up through the sidepulls to the rail, match on it, bring the feet around the bulge, and finish on bumps and edges for an easy topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is less than ideal. I used a pad on the rock to the left and one for the immediate fall zone below. Despite the surrounding rocks, they never were an issue during my experience.
content.location: It climbs the undercut bulge on Sunswoon's north face.

content.description: Sit start at the northwest arete with a left hand sidepull on the north face and a right hand jug at the arete. From there, pull up to a three-finger left hand pocket, bump it up again through a pair of edges, follow with the right hand to an edge with a thumb-catch, then deadpoint an edge just below the lip, reach the lip, and make an easy mantel on top.
content.protection: The immediate landing is great, but the problem falls away directly behind the problem. Bring a pad or two and preferably a spot.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Sunswoon.

content.description: Stand start with edges six feet off the deck. From there, reach a right hand pocket, follow with the left hand to a gaston on the gash, reach the lip, and pull on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads and a spot if you got it. The landing is less than ideal. The rock directly behind the problem gives the problem some spice.
content.location: It climbs the vertical gash on Sunswoon's west face.
